page.title: 06PLAYING FIELDS
page.content: PENYLAN FIELD IS AN AREA OF OPEN GRASSLAND WITH BRICK BUILT CHANGING ROOMS AND A MARKED FOOTBALL PITCH. A SMALLER OPEN AREA NEAR THE DORALLT INN CONTAINS A CHILDRENS ROUNDABOUT AND SWINGS. THERE IS A FENCED GRASS AREA OWNED BY HENLLYS COMMUNITY COUNCIL CONTAINING A BENCH AND CHILDRENS FRAMES. SITUATED IN THE SOUTH WEST CORNER OF THE BLOCK IS THE ANCIENT HILL FORT OF TWMBARLUM, A WELL KNOWN LAND MARK WHICH HAS MANY LEGENDS ASSOCIATED WITH IT. THE AREA IS USED BY WALKERS, PICNICKERS AND SIGHTSEERS AND IS GRAZED BY SHEEP. WORKMEN EMPLOYED BY THE MANPOWER SERVICES COMMISSION, ARE BUILDING STEPS INTO THE MOUND. EROSION, CAUSED BY MOTOR BIKE SCRAMBLING, IS A PROBLEM.
